name: fixelcorrespondence
description:
Obtain fixel-fixel correpondence between a subject fixel image and a template fixel mask.

It is assumed that the subject image has already been spatially normalised and is aligned with the template. The output fixel image will have the same fixels (and directions) of the template.

References:
author: MRTrix3 Developers

inputs.name: subject_data
inputs.description: the input subject fixel data file. This should be a file inside the fixel directory

inputs.name: output_directory
inputs.description: the fixel directory where the output file will be written.

inputs.name: output_data
inputs.description: the name of the output fixel data file. This will be placed in the output fixel directory

inputs.name: angle
inputs.description: the max angle threshold for computing inter-subject fixel correspondence (Default: 45 degrees)

inputs.name: quiet
inputs.description: do not display information messages or progress status; alternatively, this can be achieved by setting the MRTRIX_QUIET environment variable to a non-empty string.

inputs.name: force
inputs.description: force overwrite of output files (caution: using the same file as input and output might cause unexpected behaviour).

inputs.name: nthreads
inputs.description: use this number of threads in multi-threaded applications (set to 0 to disable multi-threading).

inputs.name: config
inputs.description: temporarily set the value of an MRtrix config file entry.

type.name: config
type.description: temporarily set the value of an MRtrix config file entry.

inputs.name: key
inputs.description: temporarily set the value of an MRtrix config file entry.

inputs.name: value
inputs.description: temporarily set the value of an MRtrix config file entry.

inputs.name: help
inputs.description: display this information page and exit.
